means: 使（付款等）在较早的日期开始生效

sentence.Network_en: He had to back down on plans to backdate the tax changes.
sentence.Network_cn: 他不得不放弃追溯税收调整的计划。

sentence.Network_en: Anyone who has overpaid tax will be able to backdate their claim to last April.
sentence.Network_cn: 超额纳税者申领退款可以从去年4月算起。

sentence.Network_en: Backdate your invoice to April 1 st.
sentence.Network_cn: 你的发票日期应填到4月1日算起.

entry.tran: 追溯；使（从过去某个日期）开始生效
entry.def: If a document or an arrangement is backdated, it is valid from a date before the date when it is completed or signed.

example.ex: The contract that was signed on Thursday morning was backdated to March 11...
example.tran: 周四早上签订的合同实际生效日期追溯到3月11日。

example.ex: Anyone who has overpaid tax will be able to backdate their claim to last April.
example.tran: 超额纳税者申领退款可以从去年4月算起。

means.word_mean: 1. make effective from an earlier date;

sentences.sentence: "The increase in tax was backdated to January"

auth_sentence.content: It has been widely criticised for its failure to backdate a 2.5% pay rise for police in England, Wales and Northern Ireland.
